intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana, commonly known as the Rostkovian eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia rostkoviana is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
